business.headline: Stocks rally as investors await Federal Reserve's rate decisionAsian shares recovered as US stocks hit records amid speculations on Trump's presidency and the Fed's rate decision.

Jet Airways retail shareholders stare at total loss after liquidation orderJet Airways' stock, which had hit a 5% lower circuit following the court's decision, closed at Rs 34.04 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Sharan Hegde lays off 15% of 1% Club's employees, cites AI-driven cost cutsSharan Hegde, the founder and CEO of 1% Club, confirmed in a LinkedIn post that he has laid off 15% of the company's workforce.

Sensex, Nifty erase Trump-fuelled gains as focus shifts to Fed rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 836.34 points to 79,541.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 284.70 points to settle at 24,199.35.
Trent share price falls 8% despite 47% rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyTrent share price: By 1:33 pm, the stock was down 7.49%, trading at Rs 6,432.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Elon Musk's net worth rises $26 billion in a day after Donald Trump's election victoryThe boost came as Tesla's shares climbed 14.75% to $288.53 during after-hours trading, with Trump's pro-business policies seen as a favorable backdrop for Tesla and Musk's ventures.

Jet Airways grounded for good as Supreme Court orders liquidationThe Supreme Court noted that five years had passed since the plan was approved, and there had been no significant progress in reviving the airline.

Ola Electric share price gains after 2 straight sessions. Here's whyOla Electric share price: The uptick in the stock price is attributed to Ola Electric's recent inclusion in the MSCI Small Cap Index.

Sensex drops 900 points as Trump euphoria fades, focus shifts to Fed rate decisionStock market today: Sensex and Nifty fell sharply during Thursday's intraday trading session as investors turned cautious ahead of the US Federal Reserve's rate decision.

Gold, silver price today, November 7, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today November 7, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Explained: Why Hindalco share price fell over 6% todayAt 10:25 am, Hindalco's share price was down 6.50%, trading at Rs 662.20.

US elections: Why renewable energy stocks tumbled after Donald Trump's win In his victory speech following the 2024 US presidential election, Donald Trump pledged to halt renewable energy projects from his first day in office.

Explained: Why Apollo Hospitals share price jumped 6% todayIn Q2FY25, Apollo Hospitals reported a 63% year-on-year (YoY) increase in net profit, reaching Rs 379 crore, mainly driven by growth in its hospital business. This is up from Rs 233 crore in the same quarter last year.

Sensex, Nifty open lower ahead of Fed rate decision; Apollo Hospitals jumps 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 107.15 points to 80,270.98 at 9:21 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 47.25 points to trade at 24,436.80.

S&P 500, Dow open at record high as Donald Trump wins; Tesla shares jump 13%The S&P 500 and Dow Jones surged, with the Dow gaining 628.5 points, or 1.49%, to reach 42,850.4 at the open, while the S&P 500 rose 82.1 points, or 1.42%, to 5,864.89. The Nasdaq Composite also climbed, adding 333.6 points, or 1.81%, to start at 18,772.76.
Trump 2.0: Impact on India's economy, trade and foreign investmentA second Trump term could alter India's economy, affecting trade tariffs and investment flows.

US elections: Tesla shares surge over 12% as Donald Trump winsThe sharp gains in Tesla shares were largely driven by investor sentiment around CEO Elon Musk's vocal support for Donald Trump throughout his campaign.

Sagility India IPO Day 2: Check Latest GMP, subscription details and moreSagility India IPO: Leading brokerages such as Nirmal Bang, BP Equities, Marwadi Shares & Finance Ltd, Ventura Securities Ltd, and Canara Bank have given a "Subscribe" rating for the IPO, citing Sagility's strong financial performance.
Tesla shares rise 12% after Trump's victoryPost Donald Trump's US election win with Elon Musk's backing, Tesla shares saw a 12% pre-market climb.

Donald Trump wins US elections: What it means for Indian stock market, economyWith Donald Trump back in power, India's economy and stock market could see significant shifts. Find out which sectors to watch and where to invest as global trends evolve.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Biden assures peaceful transfer of power in 1st address after Trump's victoryOutgoing US President Joe Biden said he congratulated Republican leader Donald Trump on his victory in the presidential election and vowed a peaceful transfer of power.

Hypocrisy: India as Canada bans Australian outlet after Jaishankar's presser airedIndia slammed Canada's move to ban Australia Today, hours after it aired External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's remarks on Khalistani extremism in Canada, saying it highlighted Ottawa's hypocrisy towards freedom of speech.

Deep dive into Yamuna's toxic water and how it put Chhath devotees at riskTo understand the risk posed by the highly polluted river Yamuna, an India Today team collected water samples from three key locations — Wazirabad, ITO Barrage, and Kalindi Kunj — to examine the river's water quality.

How well the PM Surya Ghar Yojana, a solar revolution, is faring across IndiaIndia Today TV team spoke to consumers who have installed solar panels in UP's Lucknow and Ghaziabad, Chhattisgarh's Raipur, Rajasthan's Jaipur, and Madhya Pradesh's Indore.
Goa tourism down, how Sindhudurg can be the answer to all Goa problemsSindhudurg is a destination for leisurely escapes, yet it shares Goa's stunning views of both beaches and mountains.

Congress takes BJP fire over 'blank' copies of Constitution at Rahul Gandhi eventThe colour of the copy of the Constitution carried by Rahul Gandhi also became a point of contention, with Devendra Fadnavis saying it indicated an inclination towards "urban Naxals and anarchists."

S Jaishankar sees 'opportunity for India' in Trump's US election winReflecting on the impact of a Donald Trump victory for a second term in the US presidential election, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar stressed that the world would be moving to a much more integrated global workplace in the next few years.

Man whose phone was used to threaten SRK had filed complaint against actorDuring questioning by the police, Faizan Khan claimed that he had nothing to do with the threatening call made to Shah Rukh Khan and that someone might be trying to frame him.

Selective amnesia: Former royals slam Rahul Gandhi for 'pliant maharajas' remarkRahul Gandhi, in an op-ed, said the East India Company choked India by partnering with, bribing, and threatening pliant maharajas and nawabs. The remark was condemned by several members of the erstwhile royal families.

Pawan Kalyan lacks boldness to question Chandrababu Naidu: Jagan ReddyFormer Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy criticised Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan and said he didn't have any courage to question Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, thus he targeted a woman Dalit minister.

Rahul Gandhi claims 'senior minister' forcing businesses to praise PM ModiThe charge comes a day after Rahul Gandhi, in an op-ed, claimed several 'play-fair' businesses were persisting in an oppressive system. Gandhi claimed this was due to the rise of a new breed of monopolists who were controlling government institutions.

Sharan Hegde lays off 15% of 1% Club's employees, cites AI-driven cost cutsSharan Hegde, the founder and CEO of 1% Club, confirmed in a LinkedIn post that he has laid off 15% of the company's workforce.

Watch: Sidharth Malhotra's new film titled Vvan Force Of The ForrestSidharth Malhotra's upcoming film, Vvan: Force Of The Forrest, promises a thrilling folk mythological narrative. It is set for release during Chhath 2025.

'Rs 100 cr bribe' charge and a Pinarayi cabinet aspirant: The new storm in Kerala politicsIn the centre of controversy is Kuttanad MLA Thomas K. Thomas and the NCP's Ajit Pawar faction that he allegedly tried to help

Who prints Constitution of India? The facts after row over blank pagesCopies of the 'Constitution of India' with blank pages being distributed by the Congress at a Rahul Gandhi event have sparked a controversy. Here's a look at who prints the original copy of the Constitution, and if private publishers can also publish it.

MF Husain designed Shalini Passi's wedding cards, but on one conditionIn an exclusive interview, Shalini Passi revealed that her husband's family, who were close to legendary artist MF Husain, asked him to design their wedding invitations - and he had one special request before proceeding.

More than dosti? Elon Musk in Trump family's victory photoThe Trump family photo shared by Kai Trump and captioned "the whole squad" featured Elon Musk in the frame, sparking speculation about the billionaire's close ties to the President-elect.

India stops consular camps in Canada, says lack of basic securityDays after a violent Khalistani mob stormed the premises of a Hindu temple in Canada's Brampton and attacked devotees, the Indian High Commission in Canada has decided to cancel some of the planned consular camps. The Indian Counsulate General in Toronto said that the Canadian authorities refused even "minimum security protection" for such camps.

Case against sites selling t-shirts with Dawood, Lawrence Bishnoi's photosMaharashtra Cyber has registered a case against several e-commerce platforms, including Flipkart, Etsy and AliExpress, for selling t-shirts with pictures of Dawood Ibrahim and Lawrence Bishnoi.

'Magnificent man', 'My friend': What PM Modi-Trump bromance bodes for tiesModi-Trump bromance: PM Narendra Modi was one of the first leaders to congratulate Donald Trump and one of the first to have a call with the President-elect after the Republican won the US poll race for the White House.

Game changer in dry Gujarat? Police dogs that sniff out alcoholTrained over nine months, Labradors 'Adrev' and 'Cemri' can signal to their handlers, by barking or pawing, if they smell alcohol or any substance related to it

Watch: Allah Ghazanfar's spin wizardry makes Bangladesh lose 8 wickets for 23 runsAfghanistan's off-spinner Allah Ghazanfar ran through Bangladesh batting during the first ODI against Bangladesh on Wednesday, November 6 in Sharjah.

Virat Kohli announces new management team: 'They share my love for sport'India cricketer Virat Kohli announced his association with a new management team, Sporting Beyond. The superstar batter said the new team shares his love for the sport and his values of integrity and transparency.
Bangladeshi Hindus face crackdown amid targeted violence, temple attacks Hindus make up roughly 8% of Bangladesh's 170 million population.

Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Ram Charan, Mahesh Babu's group pic from MaldivesTop South Indian film stars, including Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, Ram Charan, and Mahesh Babu, posed for a photo during their Maldives holiday.

Varun Dhawan fan jokes about his semi-nude scene in Citadel. Actor repliesVarun Dhawan received humorous feedback from a fan about his semi-nude scene in Citadel: Honey Bunny. The actor's playful reply will leave you in splits.

Sidhu Moose Wala's parents reveal baby's faceSidhu Moose Wala's parents revealed the face of their newborn son. The family expressed their deep appreciation for the blessings and support received from fans.

sports.headline: Multan pitch for 1st Pakistan vs England Test rated 'satisfactory'PAK vs ENG: The ICC rated the pitch for the first Test in Multan where England beat Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs. England put up a huge score of 823 for seven after Harry Brook's 317.

Watch: Kohli recalls hilarious first interaction with Sachin Tendulkar India's star batter Virat Kohli recently shared a nostalgic and hilarious memory of his first interaction with Sachin Tendulkar, revealing how seniors like Irfan Pathan and Harbhajan Singh orchestrated a playful prank that left him both embarrassed and amused.

Australia vs Pakistan 2nd ODI: When and where to watch? AUS vs PAK: Pat Cummins' Australia and Mohammad Rizwan's Pakistan will be up against each other in the second ODI of the three-match series on Thursday, November 8 at the Adelaide Oval.

FK Crvena zvezda take sly dig at Real Madrid after 5-2 loss to BarcelonaAfter scoring twice against Barcelona in a Champions League clash, Serbian club FK Crvena zvezda took a jab at Real Madrid on social media, highlighting Madrid's recent struggles against their arch-rivals and fueling online banter.

ICC reveals pitch rating for India's home Tests, Kanpur outfield unsatisfactoryThe outfield at the Green Park Stadium in Kanpur, which hosted the second Test between India and Bangladesh in October was rated 'unsatisfactory'. Two days of play were washed out due to wet outfield at the venue. All three pitches that were used for the New Zealand series received a 'satisfactory' rating.

South Africa not looking at India series as T20 World Cup rematch: MarkramSouth Africa's captain Aiden Markram emphasised that the upcoming T20I series against India won't be viewed as a rematch of the 2024 T20 World Cup final, with no revenge plans in mind as both teams prepare for the November 8 opener.

IPL auction not motivation for South Africa players in T20Is vs India: Aiden MakramSouth Africa vs India: Captain Aiden Markram said he would be happy if the Proteas stars performed well and attracted the attention of owners and scouts in the lead-up to the IPL mega auction. India and South Africa will play a 4-match T20I series, starting November 8.

India likely to play in UAE, PCB ready for Hybrid ModelThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said that it is ready to make changes to the schedule of the Champions Trophy to be held next year. India are likely to play their matches in Dubai or Sharjah.

Arjun Erigaisi rises to World No. 2 in live ratings, only behind Magnus CarlsenArjun Erigaisi moved his way up to No.2 in the rankings after beating Alexey Sarana in the third round of the Chennai Grand Masters 2024 on Thursday, November 7, in Chennai.

From Sneh Rana to Issy Wong: Top talking points from WPL RetentionsWPL 2025 Retention: The five teams participating in the upcoming edition of the WPL named their list of retained and released players. Gujarat Giants released two of their most senior players and will go into the auction with a purse of INR 4.40 crore.

James Anderson reveals why he registered for IPL auction: 'I can still play' IPL 2025 mega auction: James Anderson, 42, expressed interest to feature in the Indian Premier League for the first time in his career. The former England pacer has registered for the auction at a base price of Rs 1.25 crore.

South Africa vs India T20Is: Live Streaming, Schedule and all you need to knowIndia's T20I squad, led by Suryakumar Yadav, prepares for an intense four-match series against South Africa, starting November 8, aiming to extend their T20 dominance as both sides anticipate a rematch of the thrilling T20 World Cup final.

Virat Kohli announces new management team: 'They share my love for sport'India cricketer Virat Kohli announced his association with a new management team, Sporting Beyond. The superstar batter said the new team shares his love for the sport and his values of integrity and transparency.

Suryakumar not overthinking about Test comeback: Will happen by itselfSuryakumar Yadav expressed patience about his Test comeback, focusing on T20I responsibilities as India heads into their series against South Africa, while the Test squad prepares for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy clash with Australia.

WPL 2025 Retention Full List: MI release hat-trick hero, RCB retain winning sideWPL 2025 Retention: Mumbai Indians released England's Issy Wong, who holds the record for becoming the first bowler in the history of the tournament to take a hat-trick. Gujarat Giants released six players and have the highest purse. Royal Challengers Bengaluru also let go six players, incuding Nadine de Klerk.

ICC to release Champions Trophy 2025 schedule on November 11: ReportThe International Cricket Council (ICC) is likely to announce the schedule for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on November 11 as a special delegation is set to visit Lahore.

Suryakumar Yadav defends 'leader' Rohit Sharma, reveals captaincy inspiration Speaking to the press on the eve of the T20I series opener in Durban, captain Suryakumar Yadav said he has learnt a lot from Rohit Sharma's leadership style. Suryakumar said he learnt the art of staying balanced from his Mumbai Indians teammate.

'Ruturaj ka time ayega': Suryakumar Yadav backs batter to gain India spot soonSuryakumar Yadav backed Ruturaj Gaikwad to earn his spot back in the national squad, highlighting the batter's consistency across formats and suggesting his recent domestic performance could soon lead to a well-deserved return to India's lineup.

Aaron Finch disagrees with Gavaskar, asks Rohit to be with wife for special momentFormer Australia cricketer Aaron Finch has disagreed with Sunil Gavaskar who asked Rohit Sharma to leave captaincy for the upcoming Test series vs Australia and hand it to Jasprit Bumrah.

Kapil Dev's advice to struggling India batters: Go back to basicsKapil Dev advised India's underperforming batters to return to basics and practice intensively ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, emphasising the importance of strong preparation as India looks to secure a spot in the World Test Championship final.

WPL Retention 2025 Highlights: Mumbai Indians release Issy Wong, Gujarat Giants with highest purseWPL 2025 Retention Highlights: Gujarat Giants will go into the auction with the highest purse of INR 4.40 crore. Mumbai Indians released fast-bowling all-rounder Issy Wong, while South Africa's Nadine de Klerk let go Nadine de Klerk.

Ricky Ponting suggests Babar Azam to take Virat Kohli's route to regain formLegendary Australia captain Ricky Ponting has suggested Pakistan star Babar Azam to stay away from the game for some time like Virat Kohli to regain form.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
